Source code for kep.reader.tests.test_csv_data

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""Test csv data import."""

import unittest
import tempfile
import os

from kep.config import get_default_csv_path
import kep.reader.csv_data as csv_data

# FIXME
# check actual coverage



[docs]class Test_doc_to_lists(unittest.TestCase):

[docs]    def test_doc_to_lists(self):
        assert csv_data.doc_to_lists("2015\t99,2\t99,9\n2016\t101,3\t101,1") == \
               [['2015', '99,2', '99,9'],
                ['2016', '101,3', '101,1']]




[docs]class Test_row_as_dict(unittest.TestCase):

[docs]    def setUp(self):
        self.row = ['2013', '10', '20', '30', '40']



[docs]    def test_datarow_head_and_data(self):
        assert csv_data.row_as_dict(self.row)['head'] == '2013'
        assert csv_data.row_as_dict(self.row)['data'] == ['10', '20', '30', '40']



[docs]    def test_textrow_head(self):
        assert csv_data.row_as_dict(['1. Сводные показатели', '', ''])['head'] == '1. Сводные показатели'



[docs]class Match_CSV_Content(unittest.TestCase):
    """Fixtures for string-to-variables and file-to-varibales testing."""


[docs]    def setUp(self):
        self._csv_content = """\tГод / Year\tКварталы / Quarters\t\t\t
Объем ВВП, млрд.рублей /GDP, bln rubles\t\t\t\t\t
2013\t71017\t15892\t17015\t18543\t19567
Комментарий:"""

        self._dicts = [{'head': 'Объем ВВП, млрд.рублей /GDP, bln rubles',
                        'data': ['', '', '', '', '']},
                       {'head': '2013',
                        'data': ['71017', '15892', '17015', '18543', '19567']},
                       {'head': 'Комментарий:',
                        'data': []}]

        self._rows = [['', 'Год / Year', 'Кварталы / Quarters', '', '', ''],
                      ['Объем ВВП, млрд.рублей /GDP, bln rubles', '', '', '', '', ''],
                      ['2013', '71017', '15892', '17015', '18543', '19567'],
                      ['Комментарий:']]



[docs]    def test_sample_dict_and_rows_lengths(self):
        assert len(self._dicts) == 3
        assert len(self._rows) == 4
        # skipping rows with empty 'head' 
        # dicts count is fewer than rows count
        assert len(self._dicts) < len(self._rows)




[docs]class TestCSV_yield_from_string(Match_CSV_Content):

[docs]    def test_yield_from_string(self):
        assert list(csv_data.yield_dicts_from_string(self._csv_content)) == self._dicts




[docs]class TestCSV_Reader(Match_CSV_Content):
    @staticmethod

[docs]    def make_file(content_string):
        with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile('w', delete=False, encoding='utf-8') as fp:
            fp.write(content_string)
        return fp.name



[docs]    def setUp(self):
        super().setUp()
        self.filename1 = self.make_file(self._csv_content)



[docs]    def tearDown(self):
        os.remove(self.filename1)



[docs]    def test_csv_dummy_content_reading_as_class(self):
        dicts_gen = csv_data.csv_file_to_dicts(path=self.filename1)
        assert list(dicts_gen) == self._dicts



[docs]class TestCSV_Default_DataSource(unittest.TestCase):

[docs]    def setUp(self):
        self.csv_path = get_default_csv_path()



[docs]    def test_reading_default_csv(self):
        cr = csv_data.CSV_Reader(path=self.csv_path)
        assert len(cr.rows) > 4600
        csv_dicts = list(cr.yield_dicts())
        assert len(csv_dicts) > 4300


if __name__ == "__main__":
    unittest.main()
